revised_title: Stability of Earth's Axis and Planetary Systems
tldr: The author, Henry Hennessy, investigates the stability of the Earth's axis of rotation and the influence of various factors, such as the displacement of the Earth's interior strata and the effects of local elevation and depressions at the Earth's surface. He concludes that these factors contribute to the stability of the Earth's axis and, if applied to other planets, would ensure the stability of their rotational motion as well.
